item.title: Best Markdown Editor 2024
item.description:
Best Markdown Editor 2024

In this review, we’ll look at the best markdown editors available today.

Overview

Markdown has become the standard for technical documentation…

Features

  • Syntax Highlighting: Beautiful code highlighting
  • Live Preview: See your changes in real-time
  • Export Options: Export to HTML, PDF, and more

Rating Breakdown

Category Score
Features 4.5/5
Performance 5/5
Value 4/5

Final Verdict

This is an excellent editor for anyone working with Markdown.

item.title: First Test Post
item.description:
First Test Post

This is a sample blog post for testing the Pugo Admin content editor.

Testing Features

  1. Markdown rendering - Does it look right?
  2. Frontmatter editing - Can we update the title, date, tags?
  3. Image uploads - Can we add a featured image?

Code Block Test

function hello() {
 console.log("Hello from Pugo!");
}

Conclusion

If you can edit this post through the admin panel, everything is working correctly!

We are live

we are now live on the internet for the first time updated now ?

item.title: Getting Started with Hugo
item.description:
Getting Started with Hugo

This tutorial will walk you through setting up your first Hugo site.

Prerequisites

  • Basic command line knowledge
  • Text editor
  • Hugo installed

Step 1: Install Hugo

First, install Hugo on your system…

Step 2: Create a New Site

Run the following command:

hugo new site mysite

Conclusion

You now have a basic Hugo site set up!

item.title: About
item.description:
About This Test Site

This is a development environment for testing Pugo Admin features.

Purpose

  • Test content creation and editing
  • Test media uploads and management
  • Test data file editors
  • Test Hugo build process
  • Develop new features safely

Not For Production

This site is gitignored and should never be committed to the repository.
